text: What is already known • Parents' presence during invasive procedures in children reduces parents' anxiety. What this article adds • In children undergoing deep sedation for medical procedures listening to a parental voice is safe but does not affect the sedative dose or the latency until eye opening.
sentences: What is already known • Parents' presence during invasive procedures in children reduces parents' anxiety.
What this article adds • In children undergoing deep sedation for medical procedures listening to a parental voice is safe but does not affect the sedative dose or the latency until eye opening.

text: Invasive procedures in children usually require general anesthesia and ventilation or at least deep sedation. In pediatric patients, the use of sedation to maintain cardiorespiratory function is a common and secure alternative to general anesthesia. Numerous studies have shown that sedation for interventions such as the insertion of central lines and endoscopies is safe in pediatric patients (1) . If local anesthesia is additionally used, both procedures are painless. For procedural sedation during nonpainful interventions in pediatric patients, propofol is an appropriate drug and proven to be safe (1) (2) (3) .
sentences: Invasive procedures in children usually require general anesthesia and ventilation or at least deep sedation.
In pediatric patients, the use of sedation to maintain cardiorespiratory function is a common and secure alternative to general anesthesia.
Numerous studies have shown that sedation for interventions such as the insertion of central lines and endoscopies is safe in pediatric patients (1) .
If local anesthesia is additionally used, both procedures are painless.
For procedural sedation during nonpainful interventions in pediatric patients, propofol is an appropriate drug and proven to be safe (1) (2) (3) .

text: The continuous and extensive monitoring of sedated children is important to guarantee a high level of safety. Vital functions as well as depth of sedation should be recorded (4, 5) . Clinical monitoring, for example, via Comfort Score (CS) (6) is common. Additionally, the Bispectral Index (BIS) provides an objective method to monitor the patient's level of consciousness via electroencephalography (EEG) signal analysis. Although its benefit is controversially discussed (7) , it still provides objective data with good correlation with clinical sedation scores (8) (9) (10) (11) (12) and its use is safe (13) .
sentences: The continuous and extensive monitoring of sedated children is important to guarantee a high level of safety.
Vital functions as well as depth of sedation should be recorded (4, 5) .
Clinical monitoring, for example, via Comfort Score (CS) (6) is common.
Additionally, the Bispectral Index (BIS) provides an objective method to monitor the patient's level of consciousness via electroencephalography (EEG) signal analysis.
Although its benefit is controversially discussed (7) , it still provides objective data with good correlation with clinical sedation scores (8) (9) (10) (11) (12) and its use is safe (13) .

text: It is well known that acoustic stimuli as well as parental presence can influence stress levels, alertness, and sedative dose in different medical contexts: Music listening in adults undergoing interventions or surgery under sedation leads to stress reduction and reduces sedative consumption (14, 15) . In children, sleep induction for the performance of EEG can well be reached by music therapy and is often more effective and enduring than sedation with chloral hydrate (16) . Premedication doses in anesthesia can be reduced if parents are present during application (17) .
sentences: It is well known that acoustic stimuli as well as parental presence can influence stress levels, alertness, and sedative dose in different medical contexts: Music listening in adults undergoing interventions or surgery under sedation leads to stress reduction and reduces sedative consumption (14, 15) .
In children, sleep induction for the performance of EEG can well be reached by music therapy and is often more effective and enduring than sedation with chloral hydrate (16) .
Premedication doses in anesthesia can be reduced if parents are present during application (17) .

text: With increasing invasiveness of the procedure parental presence is more controversially discussed especially in children under sedation while the intervention takes place. There are no data investigating advantages and disadvantages of parental presence during elective interventions under deep sedation in children. Although this was not main objective of their study, Kim et al. (18) found that listening to the maternal voice during cardiac catheterization under sedation with ketamine did not influence the ketamine dose during intervention. It is unknown whether sedative doses in children undergoing medical procedures can be influenced by acoustic stimuli or parental presence.
sentences: With increasing invasiveness of the procedure parental presence is more controversially discussed especially in children under sedation while the intervention takes place.
There are no data investigating advantages and disadvantages of parental presence during elective interventions under deep sedation in children.

Although this was not main objective of their study, Kim et al. (18) found that listening to the maternal voice during cardiac catheterization under sedation with ketamine did not influence the ketamine dose during intervention.
It is unknown whether sedative doses in children undergoing medical procedures can be influenced by acoustic stimuli or parental presence.

text: We hypothesized that listening to a parental voice might theoretically simulate presence and might minimize the stress level for children even in reduced state of consciousness like sedation. The aim of this prospective study was in fact to determine the effect of listening to one parent's voice via earphones on the consumption of propofol for procedural deep sedation in children.
sentences: We hypothesized that listening to a parental voice might theoretically simulate presence and might minimize the stress level for children even in reduced state of consciousness like sedation.
The aim of this prospective study was in fact to determine the effect of listening to one parent's voice via earphones on the consumption of propofol for procedural deep sedation in children.

text: Fifty children undergoing insertion of a central venous line (CVL) or gastroscopy were prospectively included in the study.
sentences: Fifty children undergoing insertion of a central venous line (CVL) or gastroscopy were prospectively included in the study.

text: The sample size was estimated using a t-test for two independent samples with an identical variance (NQUERY 6.0; Statistical Solutions, Clearwater, FL, USA). The power of the study was 80% at an alpha error of 0.05. Cohen's d was 0.500. The statistical analysis was performed using SPSS statistical software (version 19; SPSS Inc., Chicago, IL, USA). P < 0.05 was considered statistically significant with a confidence interval (CI) of 95%. Data are presented as mean (m) and range (r). Distribution analysis for independent data was figured out using Mann-Whitney U-test for nonparametric data. For categorical data, cross-tabulation was performed followed by computing the Pearson X 2 test.
sentences: The sample size was estimated using a t-test for two independent samples with an identical variance (NQUERY 6.0; Statistical Solutions, Clearwater, FL, USA).
The power of the study was 80% at an alpha error of 0.05.
Cohen's d was 0.500.
The statistical analysis was performed using SPSS statistical software (version 19; SPSS Inc., Chicago, IL, USA).
P < 0.05 was considered statistically significant with a confidence interval (CI) of 95%.
Data are presented as mean (m) and range (r).
Distribution analysis for independent data was figured out using Mann-Whitney U-test for nonparametric data.
For categorical data, cross-tabulation was performed followed by computing the Pearson X 2 test.

text: The study protocol was approved by the local Ethics Committee (13-5331-BO) and registered in the German Register of Clinical Trials (DRKS), DRKS-ID: DRKS00004791). Written informed parental consent was obtained in all cases.
sentences: The study protocol was approved by the local Ethics Committee (13-5331-BO) and registered in the German Register of Clinical Trials (DRKS), DRKS-ID: DRKS00004791).
Written informed parental consent was obtained in all cases.

text: Children with the following criteria were excluded from the study: younger than 2 years or older than 14 years of age, intolerance to propofol, suspected or proven mitochondrial disease, upper airway abnormalities, hearing impairment.
sentences: Children with the following criteria were excluded from the study: younger than 2 years or older than 14 years of age, intolerance to propofol, suspected or proven mitochondrial disease, upper airway abnormalities, hearing impairment.

text: Prior to intervention for each patient, one parent's reading of a standardized story (fairytale 'Hans in Luck' by Brothers Grimm) was recorded via DRAGON RECOR-DER (version 1.3; Nuance Communications, Burlington, MA, USA).
sentences: Prior to intervention for each patient, one parent's reading of a standardized story (fairytale 'Hans in Luck' by Brothers Grimm) was recorded via DRAGON RECOR-DER (version 1.3; Nuance Communications, Burlington, MA, USA).

text: Patients were 1 : 1 randomized into two groups. For that purpose, 50 sealed envelopes were prepared containing the allocation to one of the groups, 25 to group A (listening to parental voice) and 25 to group B (not listening to parental voice). Before and during intervention, all 50 children were wearing earphones. This assignment was blinded for patients (start of recorded story after sleep induction), parents, and physicians performing interventions and sedation.
sentences: Patients were 1 : 1 randomized into two groups.
For that purpose, 50 sealed envelopes were prepared containing the allocation to one of the groups, 25 to group A (listening to parental voice) and 25 to group B (not listening to parental voice).
Before and during intervention, all 50 children were wearing earphones.
This assignment was blinded for patients (start of recorded story after sleep induction), parents, and physicians performing interventions and sedation.

text: The primary outcome parameter was the dose of propofol per kilogram and minute applied during the intervention. Secondary outcome parameters were recovery time and frequency of complications due to sedation.
sentences: The primary outcome parameter was the dose of propofol per kilogram and minute applied during the intervention.
Secondary outcome parameters were recovery time and frequency of complications due to sedation.

text: Complications related to sedation were defined as desaturations below 90% >30 s, the need for any respiratory support, arterial hypotension (<15% below the lower limit adapted to age), or vomiting. Recovery time was defined as time until eye opening after discontinuation of procedure and sedation. Complications, unintended awakening, and recovery time were documented. Sedation was carried out by pediatric intensivists according to international guidelines (4). Interventions were performed by different intensivists or gastroenterologists. The following sedation protocol was applied: All patients received 0.1 mgÁkg À1 midazolam (maximum 5 mg) intravenously (i.v.) for premedication. Continuous i.v. infusion of propofol was started at 10 mgÁkg À1 Áh À1 . Target values for CS were 11-14, for BIS 40-60. To achieve sleep induction and to adjust sedation level, the application of a propofol bolus of 0.5-1 mgÁkg À1 and/or the adjustment of continuous administration by raising or reducing the rate by a maximum of 20% every 5 min was allowed. Local anesthesia (mepivacaine hydrochloride 1% subcutaneous (s.c.) for CVL; lidocaine 2% gel topical via endoscope for gastroscopy) was applied prior to intervention. Sedation was immediately discontinued after end of intervention and earphones were removed at the end of sedation.
sentences: Complications related to sedation were defined as desaturations below 90% >30 s, the need for any respiratory support, arterial hypotension (<15% below the lower limit adapted to age), or vomiting.
Recovery time was defined as time until eye opening after discontinuation of procedure and sedation.
Complications, unintended awakening, and recovery time were documented.
Sedation was carried out by pediatric intensivists according to international guidelines (4).
Interventions were performed by different intensivists or gastroenterologists.
The following sedation protocol was applied: All patients received 0.1 mgÁkg À1 midazolam (maximum 5 mg) intravenously (i.v.)
for premedication.
Continuous i.v.
infusion of propofol was started at 10 mgÁkg À1 Áh À1 .
Target values for CS were 11-14, for BIS 40-60.

To achieve sleep induction and to adjust sedation level, the application of a propofol bolus of 0.5-1 mgÁkg À1 and/or the adjustment of continuous administration by raising or reducing the rate by a maximum of 20% every 5 min was allowed.
Local anesthesia (mepivacaine hydrochloride 1% subcutaneous (s.c.)
for CVL; lidocaine 2% gel topical via endoscope for gastroscopy) was applied prior to intervention.
Sedation was immediately discontinued after end of intervention and earphones were removed at the end of sedation.

text: During sedation, all patients received oxygen via nasal cannula. Vital functions (blood pressure, heart rate, respiratory rate, saturation) and BIS were continuously recorded (BIS module; Philips, Amsterdam, the Netherlands) throughout the procedure. The assessment of all parameters listed above plus CS was performed every 5 min until the patient was fully conscious. CS was also evaluated every 5 min considering all observations during this 5-min interval.
sentences: During sedation, all patients received oxygen via nasal cannula.
Vital functions (blood pressure, heart rate, respiratory rate, saturation) and BIS were continuously recorded (BIS module; Philips, Amsterdam, the Netherlands) throughout the procedure.
The assessment of all parameters listed above plus CS was performed every 5 min until the patient was fully conscious.
CS was also evaluated every 5 min considering all observations during this 5-min interval.

text: Fifty patients undergoing insertion of CVL (30) or gastroscopy (20) between June 2013 and June 2015 were included in the study. Twenty-eight of them were male, and 22 were female. The patient age ranged from 2 to 13 years (median = 5 years). The patient weight ranged from 9 to 52 kg (median = 17.25 kg).
sentences: Fifty patients undergoing insertion of CVL (30) or gastroscopy (20) between June 2013 and June 2015 were included in the study.
Twenty-eight of them were male, and 22 were female.
The patient age ranged from 2 to 13 years (median = 5 years).
The patient weight ranged from 9 to 52 kg (median = 17.25 kg).

text: Patients were equally distributed between group A and B regarding intervention, age, weight, and sex (p intervention = 1.0; p age = 0.49; p weight = 0.28; p sex = 0.25) ( Table 1) .
sentences: Patients were equally distributed between group A and B regarding intervention, age, weight, and sex (p intervention = 1.0; p age = 0.49; p weight = 0.28; p sex = 0.25) ( Table 1) .

text: Before the intervention, all patients were in a stable clinical condition. The target sedation level (CS 11-14;
sentences: Before the intervention, all patients were in a stable clinical condition.
The target sedation level (CS 11-14;

text: BIS 40-60) was reached in all patients. The interventions were not disrupted by patients' movements. Purposeful response to painful stimuli, for example withdrawing from pain when administering local anesthesia was maintained. The mean CS was 11.66 (range = 10-15), and the mean BIS was 48 (25-62) during the intervention.
sentences: BIS 40-60) was reached in all patients.
The interventions were not disrupted by patients' movements.
Purposeful response to painful stimuli, for example withdrawing from pain when administering local anesthesia was maintained.
The mean CS was 11.66 (range = 10-15), and the mean BIS was 48 (25-62) during the intervention.

text: The mean amount of propofol administered was 0.264 mgÁkg À1 Ámin À1 (range = 0.11-0.46 mgÁkg À1 Á min À1 ) and the recovery time ranged between 1 and 36 min (mean = 15 min).
sentences: The mean amount of propofol administered was 0.264 mgÁkg À1 Ámin À1 (range = 0.11-0.46 mgÁkg À1 Á min À1 ) and the recovery time ranged between 1 and 36 min (mean = 15 min).

text: There was no difference between group A and B regarding the amount of propofol administered (group A mean 0.25 mgÁkg À1 Ámin À1 ; group B mean 0.28 mgÁkg À1 Ámin À1 ; P = 0.089) or in the awakening time (group A mean 14.5 min; group B mean 16.1 min; P = 0.56) ( Table 2) .
sentences: There was no difference between group A and B regarding the amount of propofol administered (group A mean 0.25 mgÁkg À1 Ámin À1 ; group B mean 0.28 mgÁkg À1 Ámin À1 ; P = 0.089) or in the awakening time (group A mean 14.5 min; group B mean 16.1 min; P = 0.56) ( Table 2) .

text: Procedures were uneventful and successful in all patients. All children remained adequately sedated during the procedure. None of the patients required any additional medication, special airway management, or resuscitation. Furthermore, no side effects such as apnea, desaturation, bradycardia, arterial hypotension, or vomiting were noted in the study group.
sentences: Procedures were uneventful and successful in all patients.
All children remained adequately sedated during the procedure.
None of the patients required any additional medication, special airway management, or resuscitation.
Furthermore, no side effects such as apnea, desaturation, bradycardia, arterial hypotension, or vomiting were noted in the study group.

text: The present study assessed the effect of a parents' voice on the consumption of sedatives during medical procedures under deep sedation with propofol. We hypothesized that listening to a familiar voice in an uncommon and fearful situation for the child would lead to a reduction in stress level under invasive procedures even when unconscious. As a surrogate parameter for reduction in stress level, our intervention might have led to less medication for sedation.
sentences: The present study assessed the effect of a parents' voice on the consumption of sedatives during medical procedures under deep sedation with propofol.
We hypothesized that listening to a familiar voice in an uncommon and fearful situation for the child would lead to a reduction in stress level under invasive procedures even when unconscious.
As a surrogate parameter for reduction in stress level, our intervention might have led to less medication for sedation.

text: This potential effect has never been investigated neither for the physical presence of parents nor for listening to their voice during pediatric deep sedation.
sentences: This potential effect has never been investigated neither for the physical presence of parents nor for listening to their voice during pediatric deep sedation.

text: We prospectively investigated a pediatric cohort under homogeneous conditions undergoing two different elective and nonpainful procedures. They were performed under deep sedation using the same medication under similar environmental conditions and blinded for patients, staff, and parents. Randomization into two groups (listening to parental voice and not listening to parental voice) resulted in no intergroup differences in performed intervention, age, weight, or gender. All patients were sedated by two pediatric intensivists with extensive experience in the sedation of children including its monitoring. We found that listening to a parental voice during sedation was safe as no complication occurred but did not result in any advantages with regard to the demand of sedatives or recovery time. At first glance, our results are somewhat discouraging and disappointing as we cannot provide evidence for additional comfort for the child during a stressful intervention. The results do not comply with the expectations that were drawn from the existing literature. A large body of investigations primarily revealed that parents wish to be present during interventions on their child irrespective of sleeping or being conscious and their anxiety is reduced when they at least have the option to be present (19) (20) (21) . The same effect of maternal anxietyreduction by presenting their children the recorded maternal voice via earphones was shown by Kim et al. (18) . However, the same study showed that presenting maternal voice during cardiac catheterization under sedation with ketamine did not lead to a reduction of ketamine dose (18) . This has to be rated carefully because ketamine itself induces noise intolerance. Additionally, no blinding was used for anesthesiologists and no objective sedation monitoring was applied. The aspect of parental anxiety is not included in the present study.
sentences: We prospectively investigated a pediatric cohort under homogeneous conditions undergoing two different elective and nonpainful procedures.
They were performed under deep sedation using the same medication under similar environmental conditions and blinded for patients, staff, and parents.
Randomization into two groups (listening to parental voice and not listening to parental voice) resulted in no intergroup differences in performed intervention, age, weight, or gender.
All patients were sedated by two pediatric intensivists with extensive experience in the sedation of children including its monitoring.
We found that listening to a parental voice during sedation was safe as no complication occurred but did not result in any advantages with regard to the demand of sedatives or recovery time.
At first glance, our results are somewhat discouraging and disappointing as we cannot provide evidence for additional comfort for the child during a stressful intervention.
The results do not comply with the expectations that were drawn from the existing literature.

A large body of investigations primarily revealed that parents wish to be present during interventions on their child irrespective of sleeping or being conscious and their anxiety is reduced when they at least have the option to be present (19) (20) (21) .
The same effect of maternal anxietyreduction by presenting their children the recorded maternal voice via earphones was shown by Kim et al. (18) .
However, the same study showed that presenting maternal voice during cardiac catheterization under sedation with ketamine did not lead to a reduction of ketamine dose (18) .
This has to be rated carefully because ketamine itself induces noise intolerance.
Additionally, no blinding was used for anesthesiologists and no objective sedation monitoring was applied.
The aspect of parental anxiety is not included in the present study.

text: Bauchner et al. (22) showed that in parental perception, conscious children's pain was not reduced by their presence. But it has been demonstrated that parental presence reduced parents' anxiety and did not influence the results of the intervention. Additionally, conscious children's stress level was significantly reduced when parents were present during venipunctures (23) , whereas the stress level of staff members was not influenced (23) . Kazak et al. (17) found that oral premedication for anesthesia in children could be reduced when administered in the presence of their parents.
sentences: Bauchner et al. (22) showed that in parental perception, conscious children's pain was not reduced by their presence.
But it has been demonstrated that parental presence reduced parents' anxiety and did not influence the results of the intervention.
Additionally, conscious children's stress level was significantly reduced when parents were present during venipunctures (23) , whereas the stress level of staff members was not influenced (23) .
Kazak et al. (17) found that oral premedication for anesthesia in children could be reduced when administered in the presence of their parents.

text: But indeed, all mentioned investigations were performed in conscious children. This might be a crucial difference concerning the effect of parental presence compared to our present study on deeply sedated children.
sentences: But indeed, all mentioned investigations were performed in conscious children.
This might be a crucial difference concerning the effect of parental presence compared to our present study on deeply sedated children.

text: It is well known that with increasing invasiveness of interventions on their children, the parents' desire being present decreases (19, 21) . Therefore, as a reasonable compromise, we decided to investigate the effect of listening to parental voice instead of being physically present.
sentences: It is well known that with increasing invasiveness of interventions on their children, the parents' desire being present decreases (19, 21) .
Therefore, as a reasonable compromise, we decided to investigate the effect of listening to parental voice instead of being physically present.

text: The fact that we could not show any effect on the sedative dose might be due to certain limitations: To permit double-blinding, we decided that parental voice was only started after induction of deep sedation/anesthesia. Therefore, data for propofol consumption refer to the whole sedation, sleep induction included. As the time shortly ahead of an invasive procedure is often the most anxious for a child, it could have been beneficial to start earlier. Nevertheless, parents were always allowed to stay with the child until midazolam administration. In addition, there is no bias in data as induction of deep sedation/anesthesia was performed in a standardized manner in both groups. However, for short procedures, the provided sedative dose for induction of deep sedation/anesthesia represents a large part of the total dose used. Possibly, taking into account only the propofol dose given after the induction, results might have been different. Furthermore, the demand of sedatives for sleep induction might be reduced by listening to the parental voice when the child is still conscious.
sentences: The fact that we could not show any effect on the sedative dose might be due to certain limitations: To permit double-blinding, we decided that parental voice was only started after induction of deep sedation/anesthesia.
Therefore, data for propofol consumption refer to the whole sedation, sleep induction included.
As the time shortly ahead of an invasive procedure is often the most anxious for a child, it could have been beneficial to start earlier.
Nevertheless, parents were always allowed to stay with the child until midazolam administration.
In addition, there is no bias in data as induction of deep sedation/anesthesia was performed in a standardized manner in both groups.
However, for short procedures, the provided sedative dose for induction of deep sedation/anesthesia represents a large part of the total dose used.
Possibly, taking into account only the propofol dose given after the induction, results might have been different.
Furthermore, the demand of sedatives for sleep induction might be reduced by listening to the parental voice when the child is still conscious.

text: In total, propofol doses seemed to be rather high. The short period of intervention and the proportion of propofol applied for sleep induction included in the charged sedative dose might be an explanation for the high doses required in both groups.
sentences: In total, propofol doses seemed to be rather high.
The short period of intervention and the proportion of propofol applied for sleep induction included in the charged sedative dose might be an explanation for the high doses required in both groups.

text: For the procedures in our study, deep sedation was required. The assessment of reliable CSs in the differentiation between deeply and very deeply sedated patients is nearly impossible. To provide more objective data, we added BIS to the sedation protocol. We are fully aware that the use of BIS is limited due to its interindividual differences (13), but it might help to avoid oversedation by keeping the patient above a lower threshold. In general, a completely objective and standardized interindividual comparison of sedation depth is rather difficult.
sentences: For the procedures in our study, deep sedation was required.
The assessment of reliable CSs in the differentiation between deeply and very deeply sedated patients is nearly impossible.
To provide more objective data, we added BIS to the sedation protocol.
We are fully aware that the use of BIS is limited due to its interindividual differences (13), but it might help to avoid oversedation by keeping the patient above a lower threshold.
In general, a completely objective and standardized interindividual comparison of sedation depth is rather difficult.

text: Koelsch et al. (15) described for adult patients an advantage in the required sedative dose by presentation of a different acoustic stimulus such as classical music. Different modifications of the present study are conceivable. Music or stories according to age and preference of the child might reveal an effect for consumption of sedatives. These modifications remain targets of further studies.
sentences: Koelsch et al. (15) described for adult patients an advantage in the required sedative dose by presentation of a different acoustic stimulus such as classical music.
Different modifications of the present study are conceivable.
Music or stories according to age and preference of the child might reveal an effect for consumption of sedatives.
These modifications remain targets of further studies.

text: Listening to parental voice recordings during deep sedation does not affect the sedative dose, the time until eye opening, or the frequency of complications in children undergoing small medical procedures. These findings cannot provide information to recommend parental presence during elective procedures under deep sedation. Further investigations in this field are highly warranted.
sentences: Listening to parental voice recordings during deep sedation does not affect the sedative dose, the time until eye opening, or the frequency of complications in children undergoing small medical procedures.
These findings cannot provide information to recommend parental presence during elective procedures under deep sedation.
Further investigations in this field are highly warranted.
